title: Remove storefront logo and apply red → purple → orange gradient to 'Game Vault' text

requirements.text: Remove the logo image/icon from the Navigation component so that only the 'Game Vault' text brand name is displayed in the navbar — no image, SVG, or icon logo should appear alongside or in place of the text.

quotes: Remove the logo on the store front

acceptanceCriteria: No logo image or icon is rendered in the Navigation bar
The 'Game Vault' text brand name remains visible in the navbar
Layout remains intact and does not collapse or misalign after logo removal

requirements.text: Apply a 3-tone CSS linear gradient flowing red → purple → orange to the 'Game Vault' site name text in every location it appears: the Navigation bar brand text, the Footer brand name, the LoadingScreen3D intro/title text, and any other component that renders the site name as visible text. Use a background-clip text technique or equivalent CSS to render the gradient directly on the characters.

quotes: add a 3 tone from red to purple to orange of the name of the website

acceptanceCriteria: The 'Game Vault' text in the Navigation bar displays a red → purple → orange gradient across its characters
The 'Game Vault' text in the Footer displays the same red → purple → orange gradient
The 'Game Vault' text in the LoadingScreen3D displays the same red → purple → orange gradient
All three tone stops (red, purple, orange) are visually distinguishable in the gradient
The gradient is applied consistently — same direction and color stops — across all instances
Plain white or single-color fallback is not used anywhere the site name appears

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ (immutable paths)
Use CSS background-clip text or equivalent — do not replace text with images for the gradient effect
nonGoals: Changing any other colors, fonts, or visual theme elements beyond the logo removal and gradient text
Changing the gradient on any element other than the 'Game Vault' site name text
